abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey satisfactory project
            outcomes, likely sustainability, and modest institutional
            development impacts. Several lessons are drawn from the
            project outcome as follows. It was felt that the
            programmatic approach gave greater flexibility to introduce
            new items to the agenda, and reassess reform priorities
            within the programmatic agenda, which indeed allowed for
            building a better, and genuine partnership, and dialogue
            with the Government. This led in turn to a strong Government
            commitment, and ownership of the program, which was a
            determining factor in the highly satisfactory implementation
            of reforms in the financial sector. Moreover, the early
            in-depth analysis by the Bank of financial sector issues,
            and vulnerabilities helped to speed up the loan design of
            the program, and the preparation of the project, which
            included numerous financial sector experts, who maintained a
            productive dialogue with the Government. This work had been
            initiated in 1995-1996, and deepened by the multi-focused
            analytic and advisory activities, which helped identify key
            issues, relevant for the Brazilian experience. Likewise, the
            accompanying technical assistance was a key element in
            building dialogue, and in several areas of reform. However,
            the poverty reduction objective could have been addressed
            more directly, specifically through policy reforms with more
            immediate impacts, adding greater sensitivity by the Bank to
            the assessment of political factors regarding the design of
            significant legislation.
